name: Some like it hot
description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

key_work.title: Some Like It Hot
key_work.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Billy Wilder, Doane Harrison, United Artists and Michael Logan
key_work.brief_description: Two musicians witness a mob hit and struggle to find a way out of the city before they are found by the gangsters. Their only opportunity is to join an all-girl band as they leave on a tour.

constellations_primary.name: Some like it hot
constellations_primary.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

start.title: High Ground
start.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Erin Roche, Jill Bilcock, David Jowsey, Greer Simpkin, Maggie Miles, Witiyana Marika, Bunya Productions, Film Victoria, High Ground Pictures, Screen Australia, Ross Wallace and Chris Anastassiades
start.brief_description: In a remote corner of the wild country, a bloody war rages. Travis is a bounty hunter with one last hope of redemption. Gutjuk is a young Indigenous man trying to save the last of his family. Together they embark on a manhunt, which unravels a secret that ultimately pits them against each other.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

end.title: The Nightingale
end.creator_credit: Bruna Papandrea, Jennifer Kent, Kristina Ceyton, Steve Hutensky, Adelaide Film Festival Investment Fund, Creative Wealth Media Finance, FilmNation Entertainment, Made Up Stories, Screen Australia, Screen Tasmania, South Australian Film Corporation, David Smith and Evans Mark
end.headline_credit: Australia, Canada and United States of America, 2019
end.brief_description: In 1825, Claire, a young Irish convict, enlists an Indigenous tracker to chase a British soldier through the rugged Tasmanian wilderness, bent on revenge for a terrible act of violence he committed against her family.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: In her debut film, Magnolia Maymuru was awarded Best Supporting Actress at the 9th AACTA awards, for her portrayal of Lowanna in The Nightingale. An unflinching portrayal of the violence, inhumanity and genocide committed by English colonisers towards Australia’s First Peoples.

start.title: The Philadelphia Story
start.creator_credit: George Cukor, Adrian, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Loew's Incorporated, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Donald Ogden Stewart and Waldo Salt
start.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

end.title: The Aviator
end.creator_credit: Charles Evans Jr., Graham King, Matthias Deyle, Michael Mann and Sandy Climan
end.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2004

video_links.name: The Aviator | Official Trailer (HD) - Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, Cate Blanchett | MIRAMAX

end.brief_description: A biopic charting the life of filmmaker and aviation magnate Howard Hughes between 1927 and 47, when his meteoric rise was impacted by his severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. Directed by Scorsese, digitally emulated the look of Technicolor to reflect the film’s era.

constellations_other.name: Communicating colour
constellations_other.description: An exploration of colour on-screen inspired by Technicolor supervisor, Natalie Kalmus.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

links.description: Australian Cate Blanchett portrayed Katherine Hepburn in The Aviator outlining Hepburn’s relationship with the Hollywood playboy and aviation pioneer Howard Hughes. It was Hughes who aided Hepburn’s rights purchase of The Philadelphia Story.

start.title: Four Jills in a Jeep
start.creator_credit: William A. Seiter, 20th Century Fox, Helen Logan, Robert Ellis and Snag Werris
start.brief_description: Reenactments of actual USO experiences of its female stars entertaining troops overseas.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

end.title: The Philadelphia Story
end.creator_credit: George Cukor, Adrian, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Loew's Incorporated, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Donald Ogden Stewart and Waldo Salt
end.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: Also labelled ‘box-office poison’, Katherine Hepburn needed to revamp her career and would star in, and buy the film rights, for the stage show The Philadelphia Story. Hepburn made a deal with MGM to shoot the film and used her rights ownership to select the director, screenwriter and co-stars.

video_links.name: The Aviator | Official Trailer (HD) - Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, Cate Blanchett | MIRAMAX

start.brief_description: A biopic charting the life of filmmaker and aviation magnate Howard Hughes between 1927 and 47, when his meteoric rise was impacted by his severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. Directed by Scorsese, digitally emulated the look of Technicolor to reflect the film’s era.

end.title: Elizabeth
end.creator_credit: Shekhar Kapur, Alexandra Byrne, Alison Owen, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan, Channel Four Films, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Working Title Films, John Myhre and Michael Hirst
end.brief_description: The story of the ascension to the throne and the early reign of Queen Elizabeth the First, the endless attempts by her council to marry her off, the Catholic hatred of her and her romance with Lord Robert Dudley.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: Before Cate Blanchett played Hepburn, she was expertly edited by fellow Australian Jill Bilcock in Elizabeth. Famous for her keen eye for performance, Bilcock chose to edit the film around Blancett’s strongest scenes.

start.title: Some Like It Hot
start.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Billy Wilder, Doane Harrison, United Artists and Michael Logan
start.brief_description: Two musicians witness a mob hit and struggle to find a way out of the city before they are found by the gangsters. Their only opportunity is to join an all-girl band as they leave on a tour.

end.creator_credit: William A. Seiter, 20th Century Fox, Helen Logan, Robert Ellis and Snag Werris
end.brief_description: Reenactments of actual USO experiences of its female stars entertaining troops overseas.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: At Warner Bros, Orry-Kelly dressed their biggest stars including golden-era darling Kay Francis. Francis left Warner Bros after the Independent Theater Owners of America published a list of actors they deemed “box office poison.” Francis revived her career in part due to extensive war-zone touring, which Four Jills in a Jeep used as inspiration.

start.title: Who would she be today?
start.last_on_display_place: Australian Centre for the Moving Image
start.brief_description: In 1954, Marilyn Monroe went on strike. Instead of starring in another musical comedy from 20th Century Fox, Monroe courted the mainstream media by honeymooning with a famous baseballer. The news made her a star, which she used to renegotiate her contract and secure more daring roles.

His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: In the Goddess ‘Who would she be today?’, the dress that Orry-Kelly designed for Marilyn Monroe in Some Like It Hot is on display.

Gutjuk is a young Indigenous man trying to save the last of his family. Together they embark on a manhunt, which unravels a secret that ultimately pits them against each other.

links.description: Highly sort after for her editing prowess Jill Bilcock has had a prolific career overseas and at home, including High Ground, which reimagines the events surrounding Gan Gan Massacre of 1919 in Arnhem Land and features First Nations actor Magnolia Maymuru in her second role.

end.title: Guillermo del Toro's Cabinet of Curiosities
end.creator_credit: Luis Sequeira, Jeff J.J. Authors, Double Dare You Productions and Tamara Deverell
end.brief_description: Bizarre nightmares unfold in eight tales of terror in this visually stunning, spine-tingling horror collection curated by Guillermo del Toro.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: Kent directed an episode of Guillermo del Toro’s anthology series Cabinet of Curiosities. Paying homage to Alfred Hitchcock’s The Alfred Hitchcock Hour and Alfred Hitchcock Presents, del Toro introduces each episode direct to camera.
